subject: Art & Design
title: Nudge Theory: Designing Default Choices
description: Learn Nudge Theory: Designing Default Choices in one minute.

hook.text: Organ donation rates in Austria: 99%. In Germany: 12%. Same culture. Different default checkbox on the form.

buildup.text: A nudge is a design choice that guides behavior without restricting freedom. Defaults are the most powerful nudge.

discovery.text: Most people accept defaults. Pre-checked boxes, pre-selected plans, and auto-enrolled programs shape mass behavior.

twist.text: Nudges can be ethical (retirement savings enrollment) or exploitative (pre-checked add-ons at checkout).

climax.text: Richard Thaler won the Nobel Prize for nudge theory. Governments now have 'nudge units' designing public policy forms.

quiz.question: Why are default options so powerful in design?
options: Most people accept defaults without changing them, shaping mass behavior
Defaults are always the best option
Users are legally required to accept defaults
